news_header: The 2024 hurricane season has been unusually active, with Hurricanes Helene and Milton marking a busy period of storms, influenced by climate change and warm ocean temperatures.
news_text: The 2024 hurricane season has seen an unusual pattern, starting with Hurricane Beryl, the earliest category five hurricane on record. Despite a slow start, the season has become exceptionally busy, with nine hurricanes formed so far, two more than average. The storms have rapidly intensified due to warm ocean waters and favorable atmospheric conditions. Climate change has exacerbated the strength of these hurricanes, with scientists noting that the impacts are already evident. The ongoing season may see further activity, influenced by high sea surface temperatures and potential La Niña conditions, but the unpredictability of atmospheric factors remains a challenge for forecasting.
